svcsubproc.title: Bumper
svcsubproc.para: The BE Series aerodynamic bumper is attached to the chassis bumper mounting brackets utilizing (4) four mounting bolts. The front bumper assembly also incorporates the child safety gate, which is attached to the bumper assembly. The safety gate and its related component parts can be removed with the bumper assembly. To service the safety gate and components, refer to the Safety Gate part of the ADJUSTMENTS section in this service manual.

step1.para: Prior to removing the front bumper assembly, park bus on smooth flat surface, put transmission in park position, set parking brake and place wheel chocks at wheels.

Unlatch the hood latches each side, tilt the hood forward. Locate and disconnect the power unit harness plug to the gate motor assembly on the passenger side of the bumper assembly ( Figure 156, Item 5). Locate the hood harness and chassis harness connection located on the driver side along side of the power steering gear ( Figure 112, Item 1). Disconnect the chassis harness from the hood harness.

If the chassis is equipped with an external power connection plug for the engine heater, locate the plug assembly at the lower bumper opening at the center of the bumper. Unplug the connection at the rear of the plug assembly ( Figure 159, Item 1).
Tilt the hood to the closed position to access the bumper mounting bolts.
Locate the bumper mounting bolts. Beginning at the upper two bolts, loosen bolts ( Figure 110, Item 3). Swing safety gate out if gate blocks access to upper bumper bolts.
Loosen both lower bumper bolts ( Figure 110, Item 5).
With an assistant supporting the bumper, remove the two remaining lower bolts. Remove bumper. Place the bumper in a secure out of the way location.
